justification: MFA reduces the impact of stolen or guessed credentials for initial access.
Centralized authentication logging supports detection of abnormal logins using valid accounts.
Command interpreter use can be correlated with authentication and process logs for anomaly detection.
Network segmentation limits reachable services for lateral movement via remote protocols.
Immutable/offline backups mitigate the impact of data encryption by preserving recoverable copies.
Immutable/offline backups are resistant to attempts to delete or modify recovery points.
Automated recovery procedures reduce recovery time after backups are used following inhibited recovery.
